alert.note: Alert for Big Horn; Washakie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 10:02PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Near-record temperatures Sunday caused more high elevation snowmelt, and this water will make its way through area streams and rivers overnight and into the day Monday. Expect streams and rivers to run high and fast over the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...River flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following counties, Big Horn and Washakie. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Those affected by high flows Saturday night and Sunday morning are likely to see another round of high flows tonight into Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 PM MDT, river gauges report numerous locations near Action Stage, indicating flows near bankfull. Flows are likely to increase above Action Stage overnight. Situations similar to this in the past have caused minor river flooding for the Medicine Lodge Creek and Tensleep Drainages. - Locations that may experience flooding include...Medicine Lodge Archaeological Site.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Campers and hikers should avoid making camp near streams or creeks.
